heading: The Guide To
summary: What to do, see and lust over this month.

itemscollection.headline: Culinary Comedy
itemscollection.description: Television personality and food enthusiast Alton Brown will make a stop at the Coral Springs Center for the Arts during his “The Edible Inevitable Tour” on Feb. 4. Witness a dash of humor, food experiments and live music ($159/VIP, coralspringscenterforthearts.com).

itemscollection.headline: A Noble Affair
itemscollection.description: Journey back hundreds of years to a transformed Quiet Waters Park, filled with jousting, glassblowing demonstrations, archery and more. Feast like a king, or queen, and enjoy live entertainment at the Renaissance Festival every weekend from Feb. 7 to March 15 ($20/adult, $9/ages 6 to 11, ren-fest.com).

itemscollection.headline: Not So Silent Night Out
itemscollection.description: Experience two classic silent films like never before. The Broward Symphony Orchestra will play live scores during the screening of Charlie Chaplin's “The Immigrant” and Buster Keaton's “Cops” on Feb. 21 at Bailey Concert Hall and Fine Arts Theatre ($15, baileyhall.org).

itemscollection.headline: Maroon 5 at BB&T
itemscollection.description: Jam with Maroon 5 at the BB&T Center as the pop rock band performs hits including “Animals” and “Maps” from its new album, “V.” Special guests Magic! and Rozzie Crane will open for the group on Feb. 24 (tickets from $45.25, thebbtcenter.com).

itemscollection.headline: Set, Serve, Swing
itemscollection.description: Claim a seat in the stands at the Delray Beach Open from Feb. 13 to 22 as current and past tennis legends take their skills to the courts. Or, participate in dining and networking events held on-site throughout the two weeks (ticket prices vary, yellowtennisball.com).

itemscollection.headline: Four Days of Gourmet
itemscollection.description: Join world-renowned wine and spirit producers, chefs and culinary personalities for the Food Network's South Beach Food & Wine Festival from Feb. 19 to 22. Taste wine and gourmet food, watch cooking demos and witness the Food Network Awards Show (ticket prices vary, sobefest.com).

itemscollection.headline: A Gift That Keeps Giving
itemscollection.description: This Valentine's Day, grab that special someone a copy of the community keepsake book Rescuers Who Rescue, which honors local safety personnel and features works from the award-winning photographer Ren Dittfield. Money raised from sales will go toward the Tri-County Animal Rescue's Capital Campaign and the Boca Raton Fire and Paramedic Benevolent Fund Scholarship Program ($25, tricountyanimalrescue.com).
